"We know where you are. We are watching you. And if we want to, we can hurt you."
Michael Boutilier has been living a drab existence going through the motions, his life on auto-pilot. But every night he dreams of the same woman, the one woman who broke through his indestructible shell, Christina Parker. He's forced to work for the organisation that tried to ruin him, he has no choice. They threaten him with something he cherishes and he'll do what ever he can to keep her safe. It'll be harder to keep his emotion this time round. he's a different man, a better man with a conscious. Being around Christina makes him want to be a better man, but at the same time she brings out his baser instincts. Christina Parker, has decided to start over a new leaf. She's leaving her old life behind, she won't let her mother tell her how to live her life. She's become a stronger person, Michael Boutilier has left his mark in her life. Thinking of him brings up old memories, of both fear and desire, she confused, but won't let that stop her. But she realisesthat the past won't be forgotten, old enemies have been watching her and aren't willing to let go. She thrown back into the horror she was trying to forget, she's in danger and she has no choice but to face it.
My Thoughts
Loved it!!! Miss Campbell has wowed me again! Thrilling, gripping and the suspense is beyond words! I need the next book NOW :) I love the characters! The danger and mystery of Michael and the innocence but rising bravery of Christina! LOVED IT!!!
OMFG, that was EPIC. Sooooo worth the wait :) Full review coming soon @ The Demon Librarian

The action that I've come to expect was a bit slow to start, but once it did, it was non-stop crazy! It was, once again, intense, thrilling, and each even was completely unexpected. I love that I couldn't predict how the plot would twist and that I had fun trying to figure out when the IMA would strike again.Michael was amazing. Obviously. In this book, we get to see a more vulnerable side to him and how fiercely protective he is of Christina. The author did a fantastic job of bringing his character to life.As for Christina... I bet you're wondering if my opinion of her has improved...Sorry to disappoint, but my opinion of her took a nosedive. Any positive ground she may have gained with me was lost in this book. She was honestly borderline TSTL, judgmental, rude, selfish, inconsiderate, and I wasn't impressed. At all.So now I'm off to continue the story in book 3 for more action, thrills, suspense, and Michael.XO

He was a bad man, and I knew that, but a part of me was starting not to care. And the part of me that did care was quickly becoming a liar.This book...It was addictive. it's mean and good and bad. Although the book started slow (and seriously, I couldn't care less about the beginning), I really liked how it was focused more on espionage and, of course, feelings. Such a strange woman, to see beauty in a deathtrap and goodness in a killer. Christina is still whining like hell, but she is getting better. She made some huge bad choices and screw up a lot. And I like it.“I'm not going to force you into anything you don't want. I also have to say that Nenia's head is awesome to write this. The way she alternates between Christine and Michael is amazing! If you already read the first one, this one is even better.

******** 5--I NEED THE THIRD BOOK!--STARS!!!! ********I loved this! This series is kick-ass, seriously. I never imagined I'd love it so much. The second time around is even sweeter than the first!Christina is moving on with her life and trying to forget about the IMA and Michael. She's confused about her feelings and can't seem to stop thinking about him. A year later.But her past won't stay in the past and she soon finds out that her independence and security is only an illusion.Michael thought he was doing the right thing by walking away from Christina and the IMA. He thought he was protecting her. Boy, was he ever wrong. A rat has sold him out and he finds himself on Christina's doorstep. Unconscious.This book didn't have as much action and running from the bad guys as the first one. It had a lot more intrigue, more espionage, more meat. It also had a bigger emphasis on the relationship between Christina and Michael. WHICH I LOVED.It had me on the edge of my seat once again and I literally couldn't put it down. Read it in one day. The best thing about our main characters is their genuity. They are so believable. Each one trying to protect their heart at the risk of letting the other in.More so for Christina, because she has had quite the experience at the hands of the IMA and Michael. She fights her feelings till the last third when even I as a reader had melted into a puddle at Michael's feet. He was very mercurial. One minute being an asshole, the next saying things that brought happy tears to my eyes.His problem is this is so new to him. He's never felt that way or had his vulnerability come to the forefront. He feels helpless, alone, at the mercy of his heart to a young woman who could easily hate him. He knows he's not good enough, he knows his limits on what he could offer. But he also loves her with a ferocity that can't be ignored.I FELL IN LOVE WITH MICHAEL.This story is also quite intricate and suspenseful. It keeps you guessing till the end where I was shocked! But the best thing came at the last few pages. I've been dreaming of that and it made me thirst for more for Michael and Christina. The man says things and proves them so disarmingly, I was speechless.LOVE, LOVE THIS SERIES! Absolutely cannot wait for LOCKED AND LOADED. HURRY!!

4.5 Covert, International, Self-Discovery, Risky Stars * * * */*First- Thanks to Nenia Campbell providing readers Free purchase of this book.This is the continuation of the IMA series, Armed and Dangerous. Starts pretty much where it left off in Cloak and Dagger, Christine back at home with her narcissistic mother. Her parents have divorced and she is working to move on from her kiddnapping and confused feeling for Michael. Talking with Doctors are a waste.... How can you talk about being captured, almost killed and the organization that tired to make it all happen?Nope, Christine feels isolated. She decides to go to a collage with a low profile and try to move forward some how.While Christine is working to find some new kind of normal, Michael, our assassin, hitman turn lovesick for Christine, is held to the promise he made to IMA. He has promise to "work" with them in order to keep Christine safe from the "evils" out there.There are chases, escapes from tight situations, bombs and international intrigue. All kinds of action. What struck me most with this book was more of the personal and interpersonal revelations of the characters. Christine discovers her own voice and capabilitiies. Michael continues to discover he has a heart and what real feelings are. All of this is done with the Nenia's vision of how she sees things through the character's thoughts. Those who know me on GR know I am not shy in my love of writing that moves me. It was the suprising nuggets of phrasing and concepts of real questions that hit me as I read this book. Is it a heavy handed book, no. But it does present a lot of questions with answers which made me think.There is, of course, the budding romance between Christine and Michael. What will be interesting is the next part of this series and where it takes them. I will be front and center for it whether I receive a freebie or not.

I got to the end of the book and I was like "WAIT. WHAT. WHAT DO YOU MEAN THAT'S THE ENDING. HOW IS IT THAT THE ENDING. I CAN'T BE DONE ALREADY?!?!?!" After double, and triple-checking, I was able to draw the conclusion that this was in fact the end. Then I came the realization that there are two more books (I believe) in the series, and I could breathe easy, HALLELUJAH.This was a speedy read for me, I zipped right through it, and I was into the story, like full on engrossed, from start to finish. I don't know if anyone else does this, but while reading I'm continuously checking the table of contents to work out how many more chapters I have left; I did not do this once for Armed and Dangerous (nor did I do this while reading Cloak and Dagger). Perhaps my favourite thing about these books (thus far) is that they are very fast-paced: Something is always happening. OK, wait a minute. I lied. My favourite thing is Christina. Wait. Maybe it's Michael. Shit. Everything about this book is my favourite ok. Anyway. Back to Christina. Throughout the course of this story we were able to see her mature, and I've mentioned this so many times I'm probably sounding like a broken record, but my favourite part about reading is following characters and being able to watch them grow. Christina's character development is E-V-E-R-Y-T-H-I-N-G. I have so much more I'd like to talk about, but I think I'm going to save the rest for once I've finished the series!

“You are my beating heart, Christina Parker. I wasn’t truly living until I met you, and if you were to slit my throat right now I wouldn’t lift a finger to stop you, and I’d die a better man because of it.”
My favourite assassin did it again!!! I really liked this book more than the first one. There is everything- action (lots of it), passion (not enough of it), conspiracy, danger and most importantly a sexy guy who will do everything to protect the woman he loves. The book starts a little bit slow. Christina still deals with her awful mother, goes to college, and tries to forget the man who almost destroyed her a year ago. She tries to live a normal life. But soon she realises that you can’t escape the IMA. They are everywhere and her chances for survival are really low. That’s it before she got a special delivery- a hot unconscious assassin. Michael does everything in his power to protect Christina. He goes back to work for the IMA only because of her- so she can be safe. 
“I’m making you a promise. Touch her and die.”
But then he wakes up in her apartment and the action begins. Michael and Christina are together against two organisations that want to kill them! To survive would be quite hard!!!Their relationship is much different from the first book. Michael and Christina are both changed after everything they went through. Michael truly loves her and Christina’s feelings for him are slowly changing too. Their communication is often quite funny. Both of them are so stubborn. 
“Fine. You win, darlin. Conversation over.”

“That’s isn’t what I- “

“Over.”

“You can’t just- “

“Over.”

“At least tell me where the fuck I am.”

“Welcome to Arizona, you bastard.”
Basically I like the story and I really like Michael. I will definitely read book 3.

A great continuation for the series I grow to love. Another follow up that is full of suspense, humorous banter, heart felt moments and satisfying ending. After the event that unfold at the end of Cloak and Dagger, Christina and Michael have both went on their own merry way. Christina is now heading to college in Arizona, somewhere as remotely as she can find to hide herself away from any imminent danger. She tried to lead a normal student life, but she's a change person after her ordeal with the IMA.If one more person told me how lucky I was to be alive and unharmed, how lucky I was to be safe, I thought I might punch them.Her hopeless parent aren't much help either. Once again, her mum sprout some twisted wisdom that kind of make sense sometimes. I guess I will miss her presence."In today's economy, people do not want to buy fashion. They want to buy sob stories that will make them feel better about their own miserable lives."Meanwhile, Michael had been engaging with a cat and mouse game with the sadistic Adrian Callaghan. Poor Michael. He had all my sympathy this time around. The miserable life that he is leading currently is kind of pathetic. He reminds me so much of Michael Westen in Burn Notice. The guy who got cornered by the pseudo-government agency, but was not killed due to his valuable skill set. Michael Westen got threaten with his family safety. Michael Boutilier got threaten with Christina safety. Yeah, it sucks when you got attached to something. It took a pretty long time for Christina and Michael to finally be reunited. But I was not bored with the things that took place prior to that moment. I was mostly anxious and keep wondering how will they end up together again. I had a fucking standing ovation going on in my goddamn pants, and it was demanding an encore. But the leading lady, she was nowhere in sight.When they finally did, things was not lovey dovey as I hope. There is definitely no lost love there. Christina hated his guts, wondering why is he showing up to ruin her life again. On Michael's part, he hates the fact that she hates him. Despite the animosity, they both agree to stick together and make things work against the IMA and BN (another rival group to IMA). Adrian has been taking a backseat here and killing Michael is not in his immediate plan. He just live to make his life miserable. Right now, Michael had a threat from another source instead. Who is this weasel that sold him out and left him to the wolves?Christina had changed so much from the naive girl from Book 1. Now her world is no longer black and white as she would prefer. She had to wrestle with her conscience to survive. I wonder how she would turn out at the end. Will her beautiful soul still remain intact? And what about her feelings for Michael. She hates him. But yet she don't. Is freaking complicated. She just can't seem to trust him 100%. There were many times that I literally wanted to shout at her 'just give in to the poor guy already'!"Sometimes they realize the grass really is greener on the other side.""Is that what happened to you?""Me, I found out both sides were nothing but shit - "Michael POV never fail to entertain me. His view of life is always jaded and cynical. He hates the world at large. I don't blame him for the shit he had went through. Is a wonder he isn't dead yet for the countless time he was hunted and sold out over and over again.Forcing an old house to service the grade of technology we use is a bit like hiring a seventy-year-old hooker for trying out new sex positions.Michael appear wild and volatile or at times like a kid on sugar high. No wonder Christina is afraid of him. His only motivation now is to keep her alive. Woah! He is pining for her real bad. Only to find that, if looks could kill, she had kill him many times over. Well, he did try to charm his way back to her good grace, but when you are trained professionally to lie, is hard to make people believe in you. "I can keep you safe. You won't come to any harm under my protection.""You and safe don't belong in the same sentence."As opposed to the confrontational scene that took place in Book 1, this time they took a more passive stance and mostly on the run. The turn of event that happen near the end kind of threw me off balance. Wow! I can't wait to see what can Christina do, and will she be as badass as Michael? The ending itself finally sweetened the pot for me, all I can say is 'its about damn time'! "You made my life complicated as fuck, and I could care less."

Could be even better than the first, if only they'd met sooner. And boy, did I love their witty dialogues and humorous lines! They provided the required levity in the otherwise somber atmosphere.One strange thing about this book: I might even like the heroine more than the hero: It's just something that doesn't happen to me. Ever. But really, Christina is great. Not that Michael isn't of course!
Rtc

"We know where you are. We are watching you. And if we want to, we can hurt you."At the beginning of this book we see Christina starting on a new page, trying to move on with her life. There's no IMA or Michael to distract or bother her. She enrolls in College and her life seems to be moving along like a regular teenage girl until she is abruptly thrust back into the world of danger, hiding, fearing for her life, and of course Michael B. These two have the most complicated relationship I have ever read about. One minute they on, the next they're off. One minute they hot, then they're cold. Most of this relationship back and forth is due to Christina's inability to trust Michael and I do agree with her reluctance, he certainly has alot to make up for. Its refreshing to read of a heroine who's not happy to forgive, forget, and live happily ever after and act like crazy shit didn't happen. "He had his fingers on the trigger of my heart." So once again this Bonnie and Clyde duo are on the run not only from the IMA but another organization who is not to be messed with. Somehow they just keep making enemies. Its quite adorable that Michael freely admitted his feelings to Christina and he did not try to help them. "You are my beating heart Christina Parker." Christina is less annoying and whiny this book. I've witnessed the growth thats taken place with her character, and I'm happy that she's finally coming into her own.I love Nenia Campbell's writing. Her one liners and certain phrases were laugh out loud funny. "Isn't it beautful?" she whisphered. My cock bobbed in agreement. Yes, she was." Even though there was not as much blood shed and action like the first book, I like the fact that this book focusses alot more on the dynamic between Christina and Michael, and how they basically just have each other to rely on. Love this series! Love this author! I can't wait for book three."Emotions get people killed. Feelings make people stupid."Rating: 4 Guns Blazing Stars

A serious improvement on the first book. Better because Cristina is no longer a hostage, she suddenly has a say on many things. An improvement because the author doesn't sugar coat her relationship with Michael or make her romanticize him in ridiculous ways. I still don't know how I feel about them being together, I'm really torn up about it, about just as much as Cristina is herself. I sort of liked Michael this time around but its those kind of likes that make you shake your head at yourself and think there is something fundamentally wrong with your head. XDD But this entire series is written to fuck with your brain while at the same time trying to keep us moderately sane through Cristina. Shit is going to go down and bad things are going to happen. So remember, Michael is a bad man, except when he is not. Killing is wrong, except when its not. And feelings are fucked up all the time.
Actual rating - 3.5 Not without its flaws. Not without some major eye-rollers.Yet...I'm addicted.

Michael they were also stubborn as hell. jesus lord you two, just get it on. michael WANTED Christina. getting into his head and learn how much he wanted her was just a turn on (he can have me any day. no complaints) his feelings grew in the process. he showed her that he was a better man and he'd protect her no matter what. their journey was amazing, bitter, sweet, sexy and a lot of discovery. they were entwined with each other without them knowing. I LOVED IT. Michael and Christina all the way. their sexual chemistry was off the chart and i loved the stolen moments. i loved the when they finally had sex. it was a complete 360 from the from the first book and it was HOT!!!I CAN'T WAIT FOR "LOCKED AND LOADED" SO EXCITED!!! thank you Nenia for writing such an amazing series.release the third book SOON. I AM EAGER.MORE MICHAEL AND CHRISTINA

Actual Rating 3.5(I've actually had this review written up for a while and kept on forgetting to post it.. oops)This sequel fell short of the first book. I wouldn’t say it suffered from the second book syndrome but it just didn’t hit the same mark as the first book. It was entertaining but it could have been more. I think one of my biggest problems with this book was Christina. It’s almost as if the last book never happened. They are back to square one where she refuses to trust Michael. I know that getting over what happened is hard, I’d be pissed if she got over it so quickly, but there needs to be some room to maneuver. She doesn’t leave much room. It’s hard with this book because sometimes she’d say something that makes you hope that some character development has occurred but then she’d be back to questioning Michael. She realizes that you don’t always have a choice but then she goes ahead and decides to question Michael. He does know what he’s doing. He is an assassin who worked for the agency that is hunting them down. He knows his shit. Maybe she should listen to him for once. The problem here is that there hasn’t been much character development on Christina’s end. She is almost exactly like what she was in the previous book and it bothers me. My biggest issue with Michael was actually minor. I didn’t like his his reason for falling in love with Christina. A little too cliched for my liking. And perhaps I expected slightly more from him since he is rather badass. Aside from that, I really admire his patience with Christina, I would NOT have been able to keep my cool around her.One of my other issues with this book were the bad parents. They stuck out a lot more to me this time around. Perhaps because in the first book I still held on to the hope that there would be some sort of redemption for them. Bad parents always bother me in books. Perhaps because it is such an overused cliche. Yes not all parents are perfect but for the most part they won’t go out of their way to ruin their child’s life. Even when they are controlling. The plot was well paced and I had loads of fun watching Michael mess around with everyone. Of course, I also liked how he could be outsmarted. The plot and Michael were ultimately the saving grace of this book because if nothing else, you can always count on Nenia to present you with a highly entertaining story which will keep you on the edge. Even with all my issues with this book, I cannot wait to read the (no longer the last!! :D) 3rd book in the series. I am counting on it for being the best out of the 3. With Christina finally opening up and the two of them combining brain power to kick some IMA ass.

Okay, as soon as I finished reading Cloak and Dagger, I contemplated taking a break to start Fearscape (really wanna read Fearscape, lol) but I just had to find out what happened next in the IMA series! The blurb of this one had me eager to keep going! Okay, so this one starts with Christina trying to move on with her life, and Michael (separately) doing the same.This book was quite a bit different than the first. There was a little less action to start, but that picked up toward the end. Some things made me mad (Christina's mom), some things made me sad (spoiler, can't say, but you'll see), some things made me annoyed (often Christina, lol), and some things totally surprised me (the end)! I enjoyed the way Michael was reintroduced into her life--let's face it, she was totally bored without him. ;) I felt like the time when Christina was just starting college and the desert trek went on for quite a while. I'm also curious as to what happened with her mother's book. Christina still annoyed me sometimes, like being a ninny about Michael killing someone who was planning to kill her. COME ON, Christina. Times like these I wanted to give her survival-instinct-steroids.Often, I didn’t really get the feeling she even liked Michael. She spent so much time hating him and thinking of him as a bastard, and even on the odd moment that she liked him instead, I didn’t fully believe her. I guess we'll see how this develops in the next book!The ending had me excited! I'm tempted to start the next one again, but...I refuse to do it this time! I must start Fearscape first!

3.5 rounded upI know it wasn't perfect, and sometimes I had to stop and think if what I was reading made sense with what I had just read, but I couldn't put it down. I like it when the psychology of a character is consistent, and despite a couple of spots, this book did a pretty good job of keeping Michael and Christina true to themselves. The first book, I couldn't even finish it. I read about halfway in, and I couldn't take the abusive relationship between Michael and a captive Christina. I skimmed the rest, so I got the gist of the plot, and then read the very end. But then something surprising happened. I couldnt stop thinking about the characters, and I was waiting desperately for this book to come out. Strange. I know. I guess I just really love transformative/redemptive love stories. In this book I could start to see that Michael didn't just lust after Christina. He really was changed by his feelings for her. Love? Right? In turn, Christina is becoming an adult and coming into her own. (I suppose this will really play out in the third book.) This book gave them a much stronger foundation for trust and understanding to grow from.

What the Freud? I read this forever ago, not sure why it's on my To-Read list.I am hoping to update my reviews as I have a psychotic amount of RTCs all up in here, but I will say that this series is delicious and I love it.
Pretty sure my most-said sentence to Nens this week has been "NO HYPHEN", ahaha.But anyway, semi-beta-reading this has been a hell of a ride! You guys should be excited.
*Edit*A COVER! :DNenia, when will you ever stop coming up with new books?Because, seriously. DON'T.
Awesome!!! I wish I had book 3... RIGHT NOW.

description: It's hard to adjust to the trials and tribulations of college when you've been the focal point in a web of intrigue and murder. Christina Parker, now a student at a small liberal arts college in central Arizona, is still trying to forget the man who took her through hell and back one year ago.She was doing just fine, too, until said man appeared again, out of the blue. On the doorstep of her new apartment. Unconscious.Suddenly, the brittle semblance of normality that Christina managed to construct after all this time is shattered. With a wounded man to contend with and the prominent threat of the ruthless IMA, Christina is forced to face all her old fears head-on....But this time, she'll be doing it on her own terms.
